Class Setup

java.lang.Object
us.stomberg.solarsystemsim.Setup
public class Setup extends Object
The Setup class manages configuration and initialization for the simulation. It handles loading settings from properties files, parsing configuration values, and providing default configurations when necessary.

This class is responsible for reading graphics settings, physics parameters, and celestial body definitions. It provides access to these settings through various getter methods.

  • Constructor Details

    • Setup

      public Setup()

  • Method Details

    • read

      public static void read()
      Loads all simulation configuration from setup files.

      This method attempts to read the main configuration file and the celestial body definitions file. If either file is missing or contains invalid data, the method falls back to appropriate default values.

      All exceptions are caught and handled internally, ensuring that the simulation can always start even with configuration issues. Warning messages are logged to help diagnose configuration problems.

    • getFrameLimit

      public static double getFrameLimit()
      Gets the maximum frames per second for rendering.

      This value limits the rendering rate to prevent excessive CPU usage when rendering at very high frame rates.

      Returns:
      The maximum frames per second setting

    • isDrawingTrail

      public static boolean isDrawingTrail()
      Checks whether body trajectory trails should be displayed.

      When enabled, each celestial body will display a trail showing its recent path through the simulation space.

      Returns:
      True if trails should be drawn, false otherwise

    • trailHasAlpha

      public static boolean trailHasAlpha()
      Checks whether body trails should use transparency effects.

      When enabled, the trails will fade out gradually rather than having uniform color throughout their length.

      Returns:
      True if trails should use transparency, false otherwise

    • shouldCheckCollisions

      public static boolean shouldCheckCollisions()
      Checks whether collision detection is enabled.

      When enabled, the simulation will detect and handle collisions between celestial bodies, which may result in merged bodies or altered trajectories.

      Returns:
      True if collision detection is enabled, false otherwise

    • getTrailLength

      public static double getTrailLength()
      Gets the length of body trajectory trails.

      This value determines how far back in time the trails will extend, measured in degrees of revolution.

      Returns:
      The trail length in degrees

    • getTrailResolution

      public static double getTrailResolution()
      Gets the resolution of body trajectory trails.

      This value determines the spacing between points in the trail, measured in degrees of revolution. Lower values create smoother trails but may impact performance.

      Returns:
      The trail resolution in degrees

    • getRotatePrecision

      public static double getRotatePrecision()
      Gets the sensitivity factor for camera rotation.

      This value controls how quickly the camera rotates in response to mouse movements. Higher values result in faster rotation.

      Returns:
      The rotation sensitivity factor

    • getScalePrecision

      public static double getScalePrecision()
      Gets the zoom factor for camera scaling.

      This value determines how quickly the view zooms in or out in response to scroll-wheel movements. Values are typically slightly above 1.0, with higher values causing faster zooming.

      Returns:
      The zoom factor for each step of scaling

    • getGravity

      public static double getGravity()
      Gets the universal gravitational constant for the simulation.

      This value determines the strength of gravitational attraction between celestial bodies. It is a fundamental parameter that affects all gravitational calculations in the physics engine.

      Returns:
      The gravitational constant value

    • getTimeStep

      public static double getTimeStep()
      Gets the simulation time step interval.

      This value determines how much simulation time passes during each physics update cycle. Smaller values provide more accurate simulation but require more computational resources.

      Returns:
      The time step in simulation seconds

    • getGenerationData

      public static ArrayList<Body> getGenerationData()
      Gets the collection of celestial bodies for the simulation.

      This method provides access to the list of bodies that have been loaded from the system setup file or created as default bodies. The physics engine uses this collection to initialize the simulation.

      Returns:
      The list of celestial bodies
